biography.content: Dr. Xianli Wang is a research associate working in the Department of Renewable Resources at the University of Alberta. Xianli earned a bachelor’s degree in physical geography, and master’s and doctoral degrees in landscape ecology. He then accepted a position as a research scientist working for the Chinese Academy of Sciences. In 2000, Xianli decided to move to North America, and has been working as a postdoc fellow or research associate in various fields including landscape ecology, fire science, forest ecology, and global change ecology. Currently, Xianli’s research is mainly focused on fire simulation modeling, extreme fire weather and its impacts on fire activities, as well as current and future fire spread in Canada.
